33 now I want to show the architecture
that I've been using for report

it to be a multi-agent system and first
it's worth reflecting on what even is an
agent in simple terms I think about an
agent as an application where an llm
directs the overall control flow so like
a rag app for example the control flow
is always fixed it does a retrieval and
then passes to an LM the LM produces an
answer in an agent the flow of the
application is dictated by the eight by
the llm itself so in this case what
happens is I pass in a topic I pass in
an outline and an llm then creates some
number of report sections now it's free
to decide how however many sections it
wants based on what I provide so it
could be one section it could be 20
sections so this is really what dictates
the entire flow of the downstream
application how many report sections it
chooses to produce now I like to do it
this way because this allows me to one
look at those sections for example in
debugging and determine if I like the
outline or not and I use this to iterate
on this planning prompt quite a bit when
I was building this so that's kind of
point one point two is that when you
have your agent produced these report
sections up front you can then
parallelize the writing of many of those
sections um so it actually allows for an
efficient overall writing
process now what happens is I create
some number of sections first and
everything that's considered a main body
section that requires web research is
determined by this planner so the
planner basically tags every section and
says this is an intro this is a
conclusion they do not need research
everything that's considered main body
does need research if it needs research
it goes to this research phase where I
have another llm you can think about
that as like a sub agent basically spawn
a bunch of different search queries and
kick off web search and then based on
the results of web search to do some
more Transformations on those results
and write the section so that section
writing is paralyzed for all main body
sections of the report now this is
another interesting point I found that
quality is a lot better if you write
sections individually rather than asking
your assistant or agent to write the
entire report in one shot so that's
another thing I I do highlight here and
finally we have another llm reflect on
all the main body sections that you
wrote through research and then write
any final sections like intro and
conclusion I do this because I found a
qu quential writing process produces
overall better results like if the
introduction conclusion actually looks
at everything you've done in the main
bodies they're a lot better than if you
just produce everything in parallel and
then your intro and conclusion may be
totally disjointed from what you
actually wrote in the main body so it's
a subtle point but I found it produces
much better report
